job_title: Assistant Director of Theatre Services in Gainesville, GA
pros: Small campus means you get to know your colleagues well
cons: Sometimes taking care of employees takes a back seat to what is best for the university financially

job_title: Student Affairs Officer in Gainesville, GA
pros: Working with the students, flexibility within your schedule, collaboration with some of your colleagues, decent benefits
cons: toxic and retaliatory leadership that plays favorites and promotes those less qualified to do job, inequitable pay, leadership promotes diversity equity and inclusion to public but does not support it in infrastructure behind the scenes or with which student programs get funding, privileges and trips, retaliatory behaviors by leadership against those faculty and staff who speak up

pros: Relaxed vibe with caring faculty and staff
cons: Pay is terrible and benefits are worse. Healthcare coverage shifts costs to employees and is confusing to use.

pros: easy work as online adjunct faculty
cons: Low pay based on number of credits taught

pros: Passion for education and advancement of programs.
cons: Low pay for high expectations.

pros: Great students and some great colleagues.
cons: Administration is awful. They try and market as a "family" but will turn on faculty and staff in a second. Faculty are micromanaged and big brother is always watching. Money is mismanaged and salary is abysmal. The focus is on retention rather than education.

review_title: You can find opportunities for growth, but low pay
pros:
Flexibility
Opportunities to learn new things
cons:
Low pay
Lack of training

pros: Flexibility, paid time off, staff
cons: Pay, leadership, lack of advancement

pros:
Free tuition
Friendly work environment
Clean campus
Great benefits
cons:
Lack of communication
Lack of administration support

job_title: Community Outreach Specialiat in Jacksonville, FL
pros: University is always student focused
cons: payscale is lower than industry salary

pros: Caring, community oriented, close-knit, functional, encouraging
cons: Low salaries in some areas

pros: Good benefits and relaxed culture. Family-friendly supervisors. I stay here because of the flexibility I have with my time off (I have kids which means frequent absences due to illness and appointments) Holiday time off is also great. I have had the opportunity to learn new skills, which is encouraged by supervisors.
cons: Low pay, recent changes in benefits, less flexibility than before. Not much room for  advancement since school is small.

pros: Good health insurance benefits. Working with a university gives you many paid holidays. Relaxed office environment.
cons: Very, very stingy with pay. Only one opportunity for pay raises is the annual raise and that is often the first budget cut made. Numerous responsibilities are added onto your plate (as a cost-saving measure so they don't have to hire for openings) without any additional compensation. End up doing the work of multiple positions with the same pay you started out with.

review_title: Good for simple lifestyle, not for pay
pros: Co-workers, campus art events, beautiful campus; lots of time off that didn't require vacation time.
cons: Low salary, no room for advancement, supervisors do not hold everyone to same standards. Always worried there would be more pay cuts or the university would fold.

review_title: Brenau School of Nursing is a fantastic place to work
pros: The faculty work as a team. There will always be someone to provide feedback and assistance. The faculty all have great experience both in clinical and in teaching. They all are very willing to share their knowledge and to help with any of your needs.
cons: Cannot think of one single con.

pros: Staff is very helpful during training and offers support and opportunities for growth.
cons: Sometimes job expectations are unclear from the beginning which can lead to confusion or dissatisfaction. You have to be proactive about communication with your supervisors.

pros: Wonderful clientele, I do miss them. Most of the staff are agreeable.
cons: They do not have both managers sit down and discuss problems when problems arise. Unwilling to go to administration for raises and looked among staff to provide other staffs compensation. No beneifts.

pros: small cohort classes meets once per week for 4 hours and 5 weeks. Enjoyed the staff and students. Good overall working environment.
cons: Classes are sporadic. No logic to scheduling. Needs better scheduling system.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Gainesville, GA
pros: Helpful, friendly tutors to work with; students are almost always willing to be helped, even if they're there just for a grade; overall wonderful work environment.
cons: The supervisor for the Writing Center is a bit scatterbrained, and can be difficult to work with, but does genuinely try to do the best she can.

pros: Brenau Univesity was a good place to work. Caring colleagues and administration. Good support overall. High level of autonomy in your work.
cons: Some politics. Difficult to get marketing support for needed projects.

pros: Great place to work! Everyone is welcoming and helpful!
cons: Too much for family members to be added on to insurance policy

pros: Awesome benefits, lots of paid time off, small community where you can get to know people, good collaboration between departments.
cons: Not much room for pay increases.

pros: The people who work at Brenau University are wonderful. The time off is excellent.
cons: They do not pay well.

pros: The campus is pleasant and the town is sleepy but racist.
cons: Very buddy, buddy.  Everything is based upon how you are "liked" not your academic achievements or credentials. Students are not prepared for university-level work and that is OK with the Deans. It's a numbers game.
